main event: On December 6, 1954, in Palm Beach, Florida, a bright, orange oblong object was observed for approximately 6-8 seconds. The object had a round outline and a bright glow, stopped and then reversed its course towards the west at a terrific rate of speed, and also stopped and dropped in altitude.
interesting points: The sighting involved a bright, cloud-like object that exhibited remarkable maneuverability, stopping and reversing course at high speeds.
The object was observed for 3-5 minutes and was also photographed, providing some visual evidence of the sighting.
It was noiseless and appeared to ascend and descend at a terrific rate of speed, approximately 500 miles per hour.
The object traveled rapidly, changed direction abruptly, and exhibited flight characteristics that were unusual compared to conventional aircraft.
The sighting recorded weather conditions, including temperature, dew point, and barograph trace, indicating the diligence of the observation and data collection.
sighted object: bright, orange oblong object with a round outline and bright glow
witnesses: Coast Guard officer and director of intelligence
